title: Four-Day Illustrators workshop kicks off at NBF
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 20 (APP):The four-Day illustrators workshop kicked off at the Ahmed Faraz Auditorium of the National Book Foundation (NBF) on Monday.
The event brought together around twenty illustrators from twin cities who participated in this international workshop with a special focus on children’s education.
NBF, with the collaboration of the Ministry of Federal Education and Professional Training and Idara-e-Taleem-o-Aagahi organised this workshop.
The moderators included Idara-e-taleem-o-aagahi Manager Publications Fareeha Nasim and NBF Publication Incharge Nazia Rehman, Srilankan Writer and Director Mahesh Pathirathna, and Maria Riaz from Muzaffarabad, Kashmir.
The aim of the workshop was to produce children’s literature in order to promote reading culture in Pakistan from an early age.
The four-day workshop would conclude on January 23.
